summary: An email from an Assistant Special Agent in Charge providing an update on scheduled victim meetings for the Epstein case, detailing the number of victims, support persons, and attorneys, and noting the geographic origins of out-of-town victims.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: Author of the email providing an update on victim meetings for the Epstein case, detailing numbers and logistics.

events.title: Epstein Victim Meetings Scheduled
events.description: Victim meetings are being organized, with 22 victims, 5 support persons, and 2 attorneys scheduled to attend from various locations.

keyFacts: As of October 7, 2019, 22 victims (10 from Miami, 12 from New York) were scheduled for victim meetings related to the Epstein case.
Five support persons and two attorneys were also scheduled to attend the meetings.
Out-of-town victims were traveling from Tennessee, Ohio, Australia, Louisiana, Washington, Spain, and California.
Four new victims had been identified, with an expectation that the number would increase as reservations were finalized.
